Tom Emerson wrote:
> Tom Emerson writes:
> > The arcreader script in 1.6 in turn invokes the heritrix script, which
> > in turn looks to initialize JMX and all kinds of other noise that
> > doesn't apply when processing arc files. The upshot of this is that if
> > someone else on my machine wants to use arcreader they can't due to
> > permission problems related to jmxpassword and various other things.
>
> The problem is that the even though arcreader sets JMX_OPTS=' ', the
> heritrix script still attempts to do its mojo on the jmx password, but
> if an instance of heritrix is already running, you can't do this,
> especially if the person invoking arcreader is not the person who
> started Heritrix.
I added a JMX_OFF environment variable that is set in arcreader.  All to 
do with JMX in the heritrix script is wrapped in a conditional test of 
JMX_OFF.  Not the prettiest solution.  Originally, the arcreader script 
was standalone not calling through to the heritrix wrapper script but 
all of the duplicated code, even though its shell, gave me a toothache.  
Maybe we should make it standalone again or move common code to a script 
that both heritrix and arcreader source?

Have a good (long) w/e Tom.
St.Ack
